Só tenho uma coisa a dizer: Half-life

Ya tenía ganas de hacer este análisis de este juego del cual creo, sigue siendo mi juego favorito.
Half Life 2 (o Half Life en general) a día de hoy es uno de los mejores...
Antes de que le hayan dado el premio, yo estaba seguro de que Half Life 2 debería ganarse el juego de la DECADA. Por esta increíble inovación en el 2004 para los videojuegos.

Mis apartados favoritos son primero.
El ambiente que se respira. Se podía sentir una soledad en ese mundo, al menos eso de dejarte solo y desarmado por allí al inicio funcionó para mi. Me convenció en que estaba en un mundo gris y sin esperanzas.
Otra cosa más, era como este juego se daba su tiempo para cada situación. Te tomaba por sorpresa el misterio, la acción,  la estrategia y el terror (mejor ejemplo de esto último: la misión Ravenholm, donde el juego cambia su ritmo considerablemente a algo así como un horror survival)  y lo mejor de todo, en la acción, casi no siempre era solo disparar y disparar, click click... Hay diferentes maneras de estar en la acción pasando a estar con tus armas variadas o tu arma de gravedad la cual te da muchas oportunidades... Bastante ingeniosa esa arma en un videojuego.
 
La música. El Soundtrack del juego es algo fenomenal. Uno escucha uno de estos tracks y dirá "es Half Life". Oscura, ambiental. Lo bueno es que si te llegara a gustar un montón su Soundtrack, te lo dan gratis al comprar este videojuego. 

Y nada. Por ahora me he quedado solo con eso. Espero recordar más cosas de este juego cuando lo empiece a jugar de nuevo toda la saga. Quiero hacerlo cuando se anuncie su tercera entrega. Ojala sea pronto.

Hayatımda oynadığım en kaliteli yapımlardan birisi.
Hikaye, atmosfer, oynanabilirlik mükemmel.
FPS oyunlarının pirlerinden.

Oyunların nezdimde değerini şu özelliklere göre belirlemekteyim:
1. Hikaye ve Atmosfer: Oyunun hikayesi ve atmosferi iyiyse, o oyun iyidir. Hikaye ile atmosfer uyduruksa, oynanabilirlik de grafik de, ses de iş yapmaz.
2. Ses: Atmosferi besleyen en önemli öğe.
3. Oynanabilirlik: Elinde harika bir yapım var, tamam. İyi de; kontroller sapık gibi benim talebimin dışında davranıyorsa kusura bakmayın, oyun kötüdür.
3. Optimizasyon: Grafik ve fizik motorun dönemin efsanesi olup da orta direk oyuncunun bilgisayarında orta karar ayarlarla takılmadan oynamıyorsa optimizasyonun kötüdür. Oyuncuya, ekran kartı ve işlemci firmalarına verdiğin kadar değer vermiyor, zaman harcamıyorsun demektir.

Half-Life ve Half-Life 2, yukarıdaki özelliklerin tamamını hakkıyla yerine getiren yapımlardır arkadaşlar. "Hakkıyla" yerine getirmesi de oynadığım en iyi oyunlar arasında bile en üst sırada yer almasını sağlıyor. Ek olarak oyun içinde ondan fazla farklı atmosfer var, bu farka rağmen bütünlüğünden herhangi bir şey kaybetmiyor. 

Şu'su beş üzerinden üç yıldız, O'su yüz üzerinden falan puan diye not vermeyeceğim. En iyisi bu. Bu mu? Bu. Klasik mi? Klasik.

Edit: Gel be Half-Life 3 gel be yether be yet-her!

TLDR: It's very fun and you can kill zombies (sorta) and space monsters and baddies and you can shoot bullets and rockets and also anything you find lying around.

HL2 is an undeniable classic, and it's historical value alone makes it well worth playing. More the the point, I've played it about seven times over the last eight years and I'm still enjoying it just as much, possibly even more.

People were excited about HL2 back in 2004 because it boasted huge technical advances - stuff like dynamic facial expression and an immersive, game-wide physics engine. Other games have those things in them now, but people are still excited about HL2 because of the way in which it lovingly interwove them with every other aspect of the game. HL2 remains a hallmark in game design because of the finely engineered coherence of its gameplay, narrative and aesthetic.

Take, for instance, one of the game's major themes: Freedom. True to the FPS genre, the game's main conquest appears to be the overthrow of the 'baddies', a despotic regime of bio-engineered, inter-universal colonialists known as 'The Combine'. The combine are very bad, and they do not like freedom. This is the kind of simple but rewarding plot that has been motivating FPS players for decades. It is not sufficent for our friends at Valve (people who make HL2). Enter the G-man.

The G-man is a mysterious, seemingly metaphysical bureaucrat with clouded motives and a predilection for loitering in the distance / appering in edgy hallucations and relocating you in time-space as he sees fit. He makes everyone uncomfortable. Throughout the game, it's pretty apparent that you are serving his purposes, but you're not really sure what those are. So basically there's this big old dichotomy between fighting the good fight for the freedom of your fellow citizens, and feeling like you are a pawn, powerless to escape your predetermined fate. 

Delightfully, all of this deep narrative stuff is inherent within the gameplay. Contemporary HL2 players enjoyed a freedom previously unknown within any FPS; let loose in a massive phyics sandbox, they were free to crush, run over, blunt-traumatize, blow up or even shoot their adversaries in whatever way they saw fit. However, HL2 is a refreshingly linear game, and all of the thrilling little choices you make don't give you any control over the game's events. At this point the fourth wall starts to look a little weak, and you begin to wonder whether you should have majored philosophy instead of engineering.

"But what about aesthetic?" I hear you cry. Well, dear reader, next time you're playing HL2 and being 'rail-roaded' from one level to the next as you reflect on the central theme of freedom / choice, take a minute to count all the trains.
There's a reason people still cling onto the thought (read: hope) that there will be a third one in this series.
